Detailed Description

Stream is a base class for classes implementing streams. Possible subclasses are FileStream, SocketStream, PipeStream, MemoryStream, OBEXStream, etc. Allows to get stream readers and stream writers which can be used for reading data from and writing data to the stream. Defines open and close methods and allows to query the the capabilites of the stream (input, output, or both).

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Stream::Caps
 

Enumeration capabilities of this stream.

Enumerator:
StreamCanBeRead  One can read from this stream.
StreamCanBeWritten  One can write to this stream.
StreamCanBeReadWritten  One can read from and write to this stream.

enum Stream::Origin
 

Enumeration for origins for seek operations.

Enumerator:
StreamBegin  Start at beginning of a stream.
StreamEnd  Start at end of the stream.
StreamCurrent  Start at current position.

virtual Caps Stream::GetCapabilities (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Returns the capabilities for this stream

Returns:
StreamCanBeRead when stream is an input stream only, StreamCanWrite when it is an output stream only, and StreamCanReadWrite when it as input as well as an output stream

virtual StreamReader* Stream::GetReader (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Gets the reader for this stream.

Returns:
the stream reader to read from this stream, 0 if reading is not supported

virtual StreamWriter* Stream::GetWriter (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Gets the writer for this stream.

Returns:
the stream writer to write to this, 0 if writing is not supported
